metadata.titel_preek: The Great Promise: Rest for Your Soul

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Jesus offers a weary humanity a 'Subject-switch' where their crushing burden of self-justification is replaced by His finished work, resulting in spiritual rest.

tekstueel_bewijs: I have come in weakness... to bear you judgment
He was taking the penalty and punishment our sins deserved

object.identificatie: Rest for the soul (REM of the soul / Inner Peace)
tekstueel_bewijs: complete rest from the machinery of self-censorship
All things have been committed to me by my Father
this is what you were pleased to do
all you who are weary and burdened
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is invited to identify as the Receiver (helpless child) rather than the Subject (hero).

tekstueel_bewijs: My Savior’s obedience and blood hide all my transgressions
helper.rol_van_god: God (in Christ) is the Subject who provides the help through His own suffering.
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicit; the 'revelation' to the heart suggests an internalizing power.

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but a 'cosmic restlessness' and 'judgment' that only a divine sacrifice can satisfy.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The life of discipleship (taking the yoke) as a consequence of receiving rest.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (as Disciple)
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Learning from Jesus / Accountability / Bible study
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon explicitly states that one must first 'receive' rest as a gift before 'taking the yoke' as a disciple. Program 2 is the outworking of Program 1.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God now looks at you and sees you righteous
voorbeelden_mens_subject: You have to admit your spiritual helplessness
You must become a little child

voorbeelden: You must become a little child
you're supposed to be a disciple
I want you to let me be the complete master
Only I can give you that
I can give you my rest

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Inability' (Non-Pouvoir) of the human subject and the 'Ability' (Pouvoir) of Christ. Grace is presented as the endowment of a new status.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Weariness) through ~S2 (The Life Lie) to ~S1 (Legalism), finally resolving in S1 (Christ's Rest).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ takes S2 (Cosmic Restlessness) on the cross to grant S1 to the Receiver.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; it is described as 'cosmic' and 'infinite'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is fundamentally theocentric. It identifies the human problem as an inability to self-save and positions Christ's substitutionary work as the only source of the 'Object' (Rest).

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: You have to swallow your pride.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He was getting a taste of the cosmic restlessness we deserve... so he can give you my rest.
It’s not achieved or something you earn. It’s just something you receive as a gift.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are not used as moral examples; rather, the 'Little Child' is a metaphor for ontological helplessness.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already uses a theocentric reading of the 'child' as a receiver of grace.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from performance anxiety; 'casting deadly doing down'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation where God provides the righteousness He demands.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Excellent integration of the 'Rest' (Soteriology) and the 'Yoke' (Ethics) without confusing the two.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'free gift' and 'letting Him dominate your life' is addressed via the 'Gentle Master' paradox.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He took your restlessness, and I can give you my rest.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on Christ's work; the Spirit's role in applying this is implied but not explicit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; described as a debt that cannot be made good by the self.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by Christ's action on the cross. The hearer is correctly positioned as the incompetent Receiver.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Explicitly mention the Spirit as the one who enables the 'taking of the yoke'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a textbook example of grace-oriented preaching that maintains the 'God as Subject' rule while still calling for a response of discipleship.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on Keller's use of secular quotes (Ibsen, Horace), the actantial analysis reveals that these quotes serve to define the 'Opponent' (Restlessness) to highlight Christ's 'Object' (Rest).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek 'zygos' (yoke); Greimas analysis shows that the 'yoke' functions as a secondary narrative program that must not be fused with the primary program of gift-rest.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the 'Little Child' is not a moral quality to emulate but a modal state of 'Non-Pouvoir' (Inability) which is the prerequisite for receiving the Subject's gift.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Helper' trap where God is merely an assistant to human effort.
